note.para: This product is available only when SWIFT 2021 is enabled.

section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company (the beneficiary) to receive notification of , and subsequent updates, from the Advising Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval or acceptance in the ongoing transaction flow.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, "UA" and "" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Undertaking Advised function, from the toolbar, select Trade Services > .

section.title: Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: Send a free-format message to the Recipient Bank. A typical use of this feature could be to indicate that the undertaking can be redeemed as a follow-up to a given event.
View all existing records, that are not yet complete.
Display lists of existing records, according to specific search criteria.
Maintain Entity, Reference, Unsigned, and Purged UAs.

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the Message to Bank part of the menu and the forms it uses. The Message to Bank function allows a message to be sent to the bank, relating to a specific transaction. This may be to inform them of the completion or cancellation of a .

section.title: Message to Bank Options
section.para:
Send a free-format message to the Recipient Bank. This function provides options to create, control, accept and reject messages to the bank regarding .
New Message
Create a message to the bank, relating to an existing transaction.
Action
Displays any pending actions required to complete the forms.
Edit
Review, complete and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Unsigned
Review and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Message to Bank - New Message
section.para: When this function is selected, a list of existing is displayed.

Click on the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Ref., Applicant or CCY fields. The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of Message to Bank records are the following:

Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Entity/Beneficiary Name
The Entity or name of the beneficiary associated with the transaction.
Bank Ref.
The reference ID for the Bank.
Applicant Name
The applicant of the UA.
CCY
The Currency of the UA.
Amount
The amount of the UA.
Issue Date
Issue date of the , if it is known by the system.
Expiry Date
The expiry date of the , if it is known by the system.
Click on the System ID field to select the required entry.
The input form for creating a free-format message is as follows:

section.title: New Message Form - Reference and Purpose

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
(Button at the right-hand side of the Reference and Purpose title line.) Open a popup window to show the full details of the current .
Issue date of the , if it is known by the system.
Expiry date (estimated or fixed) of the , if it exists.
The instrument type allotted to undertaking

section.title: New Message Form - Message to Bank

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Select from the dropdown list: Correspondence or Request For Settlement.
Currency code (three alphabetic characters) and amount (maximum 15 characters including delimiters) of the Undertaking.
Text of your message to the bank.

section.title: New Message Form - File Upload Details

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: This column does not have a header and displays icons for the type of file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
This column shows the file names of all documents that have been uploaded with the UA. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
This column shows the title of all documents that have been uploaded for the UA. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

entry.para: Click this button to download the file to the local system. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
Click this button to delete the uploaded file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

Click this button to attach a file from your local system to give additional details pertaining to this UA request. It will open the File Details popup. Enter the title for the file upload and browse to the location of the file, and select the file to upload.
Choose the option by which to send the attachments supporting the LC to the Issuing Bank. Select from the dropdown list:

para.programlisting: SWIFTNet FileAct Fax Transfer Email Transfer Postal Delivery Courier Delivery Host-to-Host (Proprietary bank channel) Other delivery channel

listitem.para: This dropdown is enabled when you add a file in the File Upload Details section. For more information on adding a file, refer to the topic From Scratch Form - File Upload Details.

entry.para: Name
Type
Description

row.entry: Click this button to save the current UA details. The UA will be saved with a status of "Draft" and can be updated and finalised at a later time.
This option will submit the UA for submission to the bank. If further Authorisations are required, it will be held back with a status of "Unsigned" until submitted by an Authorizing user.

entry.para: Click this button cancel the update to the UA and to clear any details.
This button displays an online help facility that describes the fields associated with the UA form.

section.title: Message to Bank - Actions
section.para: When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that requires an action from customers. Click on the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Ref., Applicant, or Ccy fields. The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of Message to Bank - Action Required records are in the following table:

entry.para: Field
Description
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
The Entity associated with the transaction.
The type of record. (New, etc.)
The name of the customer applying for the UA.
The Currency of the UA.
The amount of the UA.
The type of action required message.
The status (action required) for the type of message.

section.para: Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.
The input form is as follows:

Expiry date (estimated or fixed) of the , if it exists.
The instrument type allotted to undertaking

This column shows the title of all documents that have been uploaded for the UA. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

Choose the option by which to send the attachments supporting the LC to the Issuing Bank. Select from the dropdown list:

section.title: Message to Bank - Edit
section.para: This option allows a Message to Bank that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

section.title: Message to Bank - Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a Message to Bank record that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending
section.para: This function will display a list of all Undertaking Advised records that have not been approved by the bank. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, System Id, Status or Applicant fields.
To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of UAs are the following:
Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Entity/Beneficiary Name
The Entity or name of beneficiary associated with the transaction.
Type
The type of record. (New, etc.)
Status
The status of the UA. (Incomplete, Draft, Etc.)
Applicant Name
The name of the counerparty.
Input Date
The date the UA was Issued.
Users
Details of users who have modified the UA.
Submitted entries can only be viewed.

section.title: Inquiry
section.para: This function will display a list of all UAs that have been submitted to the bank and accepted. These can only be viewed.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, System Id, Bank Ref., Applicant, or CCY fields.
To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of Fixed deposits are the following:
Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Entity/Beneficiary Name
The Entity or name of beneficiary associated with the transaction.
Bank Ref.
The reference number the bank uses to identify this UA.
Our Reference
The unique number used by the you (customer) for this UA.
Applicant Name
The counterparty associated with this UA.
Ccy
The currency of the UA.
Amount
The amount of the UA.
Issue Date
The date on which the UA was issued.
Status
The status of the UA. (Incomplete, Draft, and more).
Click on the icons on the left of each entry to view their details or history.

section.title: Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Undertaking Advised records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: UA Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: Lists all UA transactions and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now associate an entity for the UA by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a UA record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: Maintenance - Unsigned
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) UAs.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Maintenance - Purged
section.para: List and optionally delete UA transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Maintenance - Rejected
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Undertaking Advised records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
